message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about training autoregressive models to better predict under the test metric, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on NLP and related topics. The paper also discusses the learning-to-search approach, which is a machine learning technique, so it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper mentions the METEOR score for machine translation, which is a task in NLP, but it also involves image captioning, which is a task in CV, so cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses different learning objectives, which is a common topic in neural networks, so cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible sub-category.
